[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Virtual-EDU document defines requirements for developing and testing a distance learning system.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: Virtual-EDU provides a comprehensive learning environment with video/audio streaming, file sharing, and online assessments.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: Virtual-EDU integrates with mouse, keyboard, and display systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: Virtual-EDU provides a web-based interface for faculty and students with multimedia support.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: Virtual-EDU supports keyboard, mouse, 800x600 resolution, and a webcam for video conferencing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: Virtual-EDU supports standard web browsers for seamless access.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: Virtual-EDU uses standard internet communication protocols (TCP/IP, SSL/TLS).
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: Virtual-EDU is optimized for streaming, file transfers, and synchronous/asynchronous learning.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: Virtual-EDU supports scheduled maintenance and continuous operation for learning activities.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: Virtual-EDU is compatible with systems that meet specified requirements.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: Virtual-EDU operates on standard web servers.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: Virtual-EDU enables streaming, file sharing, chat, and assessments.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Virtual-EDU is designed for faculty, students, and administrators with basic technical skills.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: Virtual-EDU requires internet, compatible browsers, and video/audio hardware.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: Virtual-EDU requires a web server, stable internet, and a compatible OS.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Exam: Online assessment with real-time feedback.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall support mouse and keyboard for user interaction and require a display resolution of at least 800x600 pixels.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall provide real-time video/audio streaming for lectures (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall enable real-time messaging between users (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall allow file sharing and collaborative document editing.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The interface shall be intuitive and provide easy navigation for faculty and students.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall support real-time feedback mechanisms during live sessions.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall update interactions instantly and support roughly a thousand concurrent users.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store user data and course materials.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall ensure secure file transfers and storage.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall use a modular architecture for scalability.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall comply with web standards for cross-platform compatibility.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with ISO 27001 for information security.
[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-002: The system shall meet WCAG 2.1 accessibility standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall be portable and log errors for troubleshooting.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Testing will validate video/audio streaming, file sharing, and overall system performance.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: System manuals, user guides, and FAQs.
[SEC] 5. References: ISO 27001 standards, WCAG 2.1 guidelines, and Virtual-EDU documentation.
